data.title: Elephants Delicatessen
data.meta_description: Go beyond the ordinary and dazzle your guests with a unique experience at one of these popular Portland-area and beyond venues.
data.text:
Garden Room

115 NW 22nd Avenue

We are now open for private events from 5-9 pm Monday through Saturday, Sunday 5-7 pm. Please call for pricing.

AC Hotel

The AC is a new, sleek, stylish hotel located right off Hwy 26 in Beaverton. Guest rooms feature a unique combination of quality, timeless European design, and true authenticity. With European soul, Spanish roots, and artfully crafted Pacific Northwest touches, we are confident that our property will elevate your hotel experience. The AC also has two meeting spaces for external and internal guest use.

Avenue

At Portland’s AV-forward venue, you’ll discover an inviting, airy and light-filled 8,500 square foot event space designed by professional audiovisual experts. AVENUE includes premier-quality sound, lighting and video projection — crucial for event success —in every venue rental. From effortlessly chic ambiance, to a space transformed to match your vision, AVENUE provides the perfect backdrop for your event.

Al Kader Shrine Center

Combining a clean, modern appearance with classic Middle Eastern appointments throughout, this convenient location is one of very few large venues between Portland and Woodburn. Host to many weddings, socials and family gatherings, the Shrine Center is adaptable and welcoming to all.

Aviation Gin

A quirky fusion of eccentric elegance and cinematic cheek, designed with a touch of a certain someone’s devil-may-care charm. Our AV capabilities? Well, they're just shy of a Hollywood blockbuster, but perfect for PowerPoint presentations. As for our room, it's a beacon of conviviality and creativity. So, bring your ideas, your colleagues, and your questionable jokes. This isn't your ordinary conference room; it's an Aviation Gin experience – and it’s all ready for take-off.

Baker Building

Once used as a pharmacy in the 1930s, the historic Baker Building is a 1912 landmark located in the heart of North Portland. This 2,000 square foot multi-use ballroom features 18-foot ceilings with exposed rafters, a catering kitchen, and a professional sound system. Great for weddings, corporate meetings, and small gatherings

Blade & Timber

Blade & Timber Axe Throwing in Portland is the Rose City’s premier axe throwing bar located in the heart of Slabtown. The 4,400 square foot location boasts 12 axe throwing lanes, a full bar featuring signature cocktails, wine, spirits, and local craft beers with a robust appetizer menu that delivers crowd-pleasing shareables for the table.

Blockhouse

An intimate gathering locale where meals are shared, connections are made and life is celebrated. Blockhouse is tucked away inside of Pomarius Nursery. Built around a chef-inspired open kitchen, you can host an intimate gathering, lavish party and everything in-between.

Bloodworks Live Studio

Looking to host a corporate meeting or business-to-business seminar? Need a state of the art screening facility or a place to record a live performance? Consider the Bloodworks Live Studio, a 3,000 square foot venue with theatre seating for 65 and standing room for an additional 100, located in the heart of downtown Portland right on the MAX line in the Pacwest Center.

Bossanova Ballroom

From weddings to corporate events, company parties to concerts, and fashion shows to industrial dance parties, the Bossanova Ballroom has something for you. The facilities include a large performance/ceremony stage, lounge, multiple bars, mezzanine and billiards room. A wonderful event venue in the up and coming East Burnside District.

Castaway Portland

This faithfully restored warehouse with original architecture is a fantastic space for larger events – truly a blank palette for event design. 10,000 square feet of available event space, 14-foot ceilings with exposed wood beams, wraparound pane windows and polished concrete floors make for a great framework for any event planner’s imagination. This new space near the Pearl District is a must-see for all types of events!

Clackamas River Farm

Situated on the Clackamas River at the Oregon Trail crossing, this wonderful wedding and events space boasts nearly a half-mile of riverfront views, old-growth trees and pastoral vistas. Complete with an 1890 Victorian Farmhouse and available classic Red Barn, this unique venue is ready to be transformed just for your special event!

Congregation Beth Israel

Founded in 1858, two small chapels provide intimate settings for interactive religious gatherings, while the on-site social hall has capacity for two hundred guests. CBI’s architecturally-renowned Main Sanctuary, lends grace and formality to services on High Holidays, B’nei Mitzvah, weddings, and other occasions.

Crystal Springs

Crystal Springs Rhododendron Garden is a unique nine-acre garden containing an outstanding collection of rare species and hybrid rhododendrons, azaleas, and other lesser known shrubs, as well as many companion plants and unusual trees. This internationally recognized garden is a beautiful place to host your event May through September. Three waterfalls and picturesque bridges add to the beauty of this venue.

Director Park

Located in the heart of downtown Portland, Director Park is more than a park or event space; it’s a Portland experience that is actively programmed to support arts & culture. Designed in the style of a European piazza, this beautiful urban park provides an elegant and versatile space for events large or intimate.

Eagles Nest Reserve

Eagles Nest Reserve is a family-run vineyard and winery focusing on dry farming, no-till, herbicide-free agriculture to produce unfined and unfiltered, low intervention wine. The 160-acre reserve is a diverse and beautiful landscape of vineyards, wetlands, grazing alpacas, wildlife, and easement-protected forest sanctuaries. Surrounded by vines with a panoramic view of the valley, its showcase barn is host to wine tastings as well as public and private events.

Eastside Jewish Commons

Centrally located in the heart of Portland, Eastside Jewish Commons (EJC) is a flexible, multi-use venue that can accommodate b’nai mitzvahs, weddings, parties, business conferences, dinners, fundraisers, seminars and more. The contemporary space features a glass-ceiling atrium and tile flooring, making for a bright and airy atmosphere that remains welcoming and comfortable.

Ecotrust

With two central city blocks and two renovated warehouses this is home to one of the most historically-rooted, forward-thinking Portland event venues. Whether you’re hosting an intimate private event or a public extravaganza, Ecotrust has a quintessentially Portland space that fits your vision.

The Eleanor

The Eleanor is an urban space that is quintessential Portland. The ceiling, a dramatic wood bow truss, serves as the focal point and takes you back to a time when even warehouses could be works of art. Corner walls are full of windows, admitting natural light throughout the day and spectacular views of downtown at night. The heart of the Pearl District is right outside, and proximity to freeways and downtown provides easy access. Imbue your next event with the beauty and personality of Portland.

Element Hotel

The new Element by Westin Portland Beaverton is a modern hotel for short- and long-term stays. Nature-inspired spaces, in-room kitchens, spa-inspired bathrooms, and other eco-friendly touches throughout the property provide a welcoming and relaxing stay.There is also a meeting space at this location for internal and external use. Centrally located with easy access to Hwy 26, the new Element is close to dining and shopping, Nike World Headquarters, Intel, and the Howard M. Terpenning Recreation Complex.

Eliot Center

Conveniently located in the heart of downtown Portland, Eliot Center accommodates 10-900 guests in a blend of traditional historic and new contemporary venues such as the LEED Gold Certified Buchan Building. Eliot Center is committed to hosting events that support sustainability, social justice, the arts, community, and education.

The Evergreen

The Evergreen’s purpose is to be an event space worthy of Portland and its residents– a venue where you can celebrate everything exceptional about our amazing City. The aesthetics, acoustics, audio visual system, lighting, furniture, and amenities are world class. The Evergreen can host everything from a small corporate event to a concert by the Rolling Stones. Capacity is 550 people: 480 on the main floor and 70 on the mezzanine.

The Grotto

The Grotto Conference Center (GCC) opened in 2002 and is located in the lower-level gardens under the Visitor Center at the National Sanctuary of Our Sorrowful Mother (The Grotto). The GCC offers groups a chance to leave the outside world at the door and retreat to a scenic sanctuary in the middle of the busy city. The upper gardens provide guests a quiet place for reflection.

Hopkins Demonstration Forest: Everett Hall

Located less than 10 miles south of Oregon City, Everett Hall at the Hopkins Demonstration Forest is a 2,100 square foot custom built wood structure situated in a beautiful forest setting. The building features a large meeting room, complete with a stone fireplace and caterer’s kitchen, capable of holding up to 90 guests. Hopkins allows guests to attend an event, take a relaxing stroll in the woods, and experience the beauty of nature.

Hotel Vance

Hotel Vance is Marriott’s first Tribute Portfolio Hotel in Oregon. We are proud to be a 4-star hotel located in a safe, walkable, and trendy downtown location called the Cultural District. We are steps away from the Portland Park Blocks and a short walk to Portland’s amazing theaters and premium retail. With over 4,000 sq. feet of flexible event space, our team is ready to make your event or corporate meeting come to life.

Hoyt Arboretum

Four facilities are available for rent at the Arboretum. A covered picnic shelter, a secluded meadow, a peaceful deck and an indoor classroom provide unique options for weddings, family picnics, retreats or other events.

Ironlight

Located in downtown Lake Oswego, Ironlight will showcase panoramic views of Mt. Hood and the Cascades through an east-facing wall of floor-to-ceiling windows. Ironlight is 3,300 square feet, and will accommodate up to 250 seated guests indoors with the ability to create custom intimate gathering areas within the space.

Irving Street Studio

An Ecotrust venue, Irving Street Studio is conveniently located on the ground floor of the Natural Capital Center. With more than 7,000 square feet of beautiful wood floors, historic brick archways, original wood beams, and ample natural light, it is an energizing event space to host rainmaker fundraisers, unique markets, and elegant social gatherings.

Jupiter Hotel

Celebrate your next event at the Jupiter, where they have creative event space for 4 to 500 guests. The Jupiter Hotel offers innovative urban meeting rooms and stunning event venues with natural light, roaming wifi, projection video and full AV set-up, floor-to-ceiling blackboard walls, and a bamboo-flanked courtyard.

Kiln

Our coworking communities are hand-crafted and programmed to elevate lifestyle and performance. The environment in which you surround your team should be strategic to your business objectives.

Mercy Corps Event Space

Mercy Corps has several event spaces that reflect the character and culture of the organization. With over 7,000 sq. ft., this venue offers four beautiful spaces ranging from 800 to 3,484 sq. ft. to accommodate groups of all sizes. Mercy Corps is located in the heart of downtown Portland next to Saturday Market and the historic Skidmore Fountain.

Mildred Hall

Located in the Vernon neighborhood of Northeast Portland, Mildred Hall is an intimate venue for weddings, celebrations, company off-sites and health workshops. Originally built in 1916, our church features beautiful indoor and outdoor spaces for a variety of gathering options. Mildred Hall offers options for indoor and outdoor ceremonies and receptions. Get in touch for a tour of our beautiful building and garden.

The Norse Hall

Norse Hall is conveniently located just 12 blocks from downtown Portland, in the vibrant lower East Burnside neighborhood. From the beautiful maple floor to the original F.C. Baker chandeliers hanging from the 30-foot ceiling, the Grand Ballroom is the crown jewel of Norse Hall. The Lodge Room on the 2nd floor serves equally well as a cozy dance floor or spacious meeting hall. The maple floors and original wall sconces give the room period elegance, while daytime events benefit from the natural light.

Oaks Park

Oaks Park has been Portland’s gathering place since 1905! With scenic and affordable seasonal picnic grounds, the historic, year-round indoor Dance Pavilion, and unique event venues like the Roller Rink and Chipper’s Woods Miniature Golf, add your next event to our long list of fun celebrations through the generations!

Oregon Historical Society

The Oregon Historical Society is perfect for after-hours receptions and dinners. The Miller Pavilion features floor-to-ceiling windows, and can be paired with current exhibitions. The adjacent Park Plaza is a rare outdoor space in the heart of the city with beautiful views of the park, the bell tower of the First Congregational Church, and a stunning trompe-‘l’oeil mural.

Oregon State Bar Columbia Conference Center

This versatile space just off of I-5 near Bridgeport is a great space for meetings large and small, corporate training seminars and networking functions, not to mention the many in-house amenities available.

The Paramount Hotel

For impressive meetings and special events, The Paramount Hotel features two meeting spaces, the Lewis Room and the Clark Room, both located on the Mezzanine Level overlooking the lobby. The mirror image of each other, each 650-square-foot room have two sets of French doors overlooking the tree-lined avenues below offering natural light and openness.

Parrett Mountain Cellars

Nestled in the trees on Parrett Mountain, our wine tasting room is a cozy, inviting lodge-style experience with a fantastic view of Mt. St. Helens between the trees. We can seat 60 people inside and on the patio, but allow a maximum of 85 guests per event. We have 45 parking spots and 2 Tesla Charging stations.

Pittock Mansion

This remarkable historic Portland landmark sits high in the West Hills and commands a stunning view of the city and Cascade Mountains. The space is available to Corporate Members of the Pittock Mansion Society for events.

Portland Art Museum

Located in the heart of Portland’s cultural district, The Portland Art Museum is the preferred venue for many of Portland’s most prestigious social gatherings. With spacious ballrooms, the sculpture mall and many other unique event spaces, the museum is Portland’s premier event location for galas, weddings, corporate events and everything in between.

Portland Electric Boat Company

With PEBC’s environmentally-friendly Duffy Boats, you can be your own captain and witness all the beauty the Willamette River has to offer. Whether you tour Portland’s historic waterfront or head down south to see the waterfalls, order from Elephants Travel & Tours menu for an extraordinary experience.

Q Center

This versatile multi-purpose spaces make an ideal location for virtually any type of event. Located on historic and trendy Mississippi Avenue, this venue is great for weddings, corporate trainings, theater events, and everything in between, this is definitely a place to consider the next time you’re in need of a fabulous event space.

The Reser

The Patricia Reser Center for the Arts (The Reser) is a state-of-the-art 550-seat auditorium, art galleries, an outdoor plaza and rehearsal spaces. The facility is a world–class multidisciplinary arts center in the heart of Beaverton, Oregon providing access to arts, entertainment, and educational programming for residents and visitors.

The Redd on Salmon Street

The Redd on Salmon Street, located in the heart of Portland’s historic Central Eastside, is designed to help scale a more restorative, equitable, and delicious, regional food economy across the Pacific Northwest. The Redd is comprised of a two-block, 76,000-square-foot campus including two buildings: Redd West, a former marble distribution hub and sales center; and the Redd East, a 1918 ironworks.

Tendue

Designed to eloquently blend Parisian-inspired textures and tones with a 100+ year-old warehouse, Tendue is a space that’s both inviting and interesting. This fully furnished space has the capability to flex and creates the perfect setting for hosting small and mid-sized groups, workshops or most anything else

The Tumwater Room

The Tumwater Room is a stunning venue perfect for weddings, receptions, meetings, fundraising events, quinceaneras and special events of all kinds. Located on the third floor of the Museum of the Oregon Territory, the Tumwater Room overlooks the historic Willamette Falls with sweeping views of the Willamette River through the tall cathedral windows.

Union/Pine

Union/Pine is a hub to foster inspiration, creativity, and a really good time. With 5,000 sq ft of converted warehouse space, a sunken living room with an Eames conference table, 11’ beamed ceilings, and private kitchen Union/Pine is the perfect location for weddings, receptions, photo shoots, art shows, pop-up shops, and more.

Bridal Veil Lakes

The perfect setting for your special event! Nestled in the heart of the scenic Columbia River Gorge just 30 minutes from Portland, 40 acres of lush greenery, wildflowers and 100 year-old forest surround their pristine lake setting. Offering a covered patio and pavilion, the secluded location and wonderful staff ensure an unforgettable event.

Crag Rag Hut Venue

Perched amidst the stunning landscapes of the Hood River valley, the Crag Rat Hut boasts breathtaking views of the surrounding natural beauty, including the iconic silhouette of Mount Hood. The venue's unique charm lies in its ability to seamlessly blend the warmth of a cozy cabin atmosphere with the grandeur of the great outdoors.

The Griffin House

Built in 1900 and lovingly renovated through the years, The Griffin House maintains vintage charm while also offering the advantages of a luxurious, modern home. We knew that with such incredible views came a responsibility to share them, and we began offering weddings in 2008.

Wind Mountain Ranch

Located in the heart of the Columbia River Gorge, Wind Mountain Ranch is a private estate specializing in unforgettable outdoor weddings, receptions, and special events. Offering scenic views of both Wind Mountain and the Columbia River, it is the ideal setting for picture perfect memories. Located just across the Gorge near Stevenson, WA, Wind Mountain Ranch truly captures the beauty of the Pacific Northwest. Elephants Catering at Wind Mountain Ranch is an occasion that you won’t soon forget!

Beckenridge Vineyard

A wonderful Vineyard just outside of Salem, the facilities are designed with weddings & events in mind. Vaulted ceilings, a stone fireplace, covered patio & wonderful views of the surrounding foothills make BeckenRidge a wonderful place for any special occasion.

Cathedral Ridge Winery

Cathedral Ridge Winery is the perfect setting for your outdoor wedding or event. Nestled in a beautiful vineyard with stunning views of Mt. Hood and Mt. Adams, the winery offers the perfect (weatherproof) location for up to 200 guests.

Helvetia Winery

The rustic house, picnic area and adjacent lawn are wonderful places for events large and small. This unique winery is an undiscovered jewel of wine country, and closer to town than you think!

Fort Vancouver Artillery Barracks

Constructed in 1904, the newly renovated Artillery Barracks originally housed 240 soldiers. Now, from the elegantly restored tin ceilings to the historically accurate white-oak hardwood floors and state-of-the-art audio visual equipment, each room offers an ideal setting for meetings, weddings, and celebrations.

Fort Vancouver O.O. Howard House

Situated in the Fort Vancouver National Site, the Howard House was built in 1879 for Civil War General Oliver Otis Howard, and today is headquarters of the Fort Vancouver National Trust. The Howard House can host meeting space or small receptions in the Education Conference Room or outdoor courtyard.

Red Cross Community Room

The Red Cross Convalescent House was built in 1918-1919 to provide a homey atmosphere for injured soldiers. Later it was used as a Service Club. Today the restored building hosts events in its large lounge featuring gleaming hardwood floors, fireplace and adjoining sun porch.
